comments.html: I think Cisco might have published configuration guides for BGP EVPN on the Cat 9K platforms before any LISP guides. Both control planes are supported, but it was originally the case that choosing LISP meant a DNA and ISE lock in. Other vendors seem to be choosing BGP EVPN for network virtualisation, so will choosing LISP still mean a form of vendor lock in?
comments.name: Pete
